page.title: 02SADDLEWORTH MOORS
page.content: The Pennine moorland in this area is part peat bog, in the north eastern section, and open rough grazing on the better-drained areas. There are underground drainage channels across the moor. The lower slopes are fenced and used for sheep pasture above Diggle. South of the A635 road there is more sheep grazing. The moors were used for grouse shooting earlier this century, being owned by the Brooks' up to the 1920's. They lived at Upperwood House and employed 3 gamekeepers. The Duke of Gloucester used to attend the shoots.The Crowthers now reside there. Overlooking Yeoman Hey & Greenfield reservoirs was the Moorcock Inn, where William Bradbury & son (Bill o'Jacks) were murdered in 1832 by assailants unknown. They are buried in a corner of Saddleworth Church graveyard. The modern'Moors Murder'took place nearby.
